Long story short, Conroy built a raft in his hotel room, dropped it out the hotel window, got it to the river just as an army patrol came by.
Cue a couple of days behind bars.
Cue the fury of most of the other reporters on the scene convinced Conroy had delayed everyone's progress to the front.
So I was on me own in the bar, a social outcast.

In 2012, they tried to get back into Syria.
Bashar al-Assad's forces were reportedly shelling indiscriminately in the rebel stronghold of Homs.
We had many friends who'd gone on other reports.
And they were coming out, and they were saying, you know, it is really hell on Earth in that place.
We kind of knew that was where - if we wanted to tell the story of what was happening in Syria and the Syrian revolution, that that was the place to be.
